page.title: 04TY'N TWLL
page.content: Ty'n Twll comes from the Welsh meaning house in the hole.Ty'n Twll is about 200 meters above sea level.It is situated on a hillside overlooking the Dee estuary.The present farmhouse is over 150 years old.The manager of the local Lead mine used to live there.(The Lead mine is now closed). The farm was there before the present farmhouse.It is a mixed arable and pastoral farm.It has 88.61 acres. 64.93 acres are permanent grass,7.5 acres are for bagged silage,2.06 acres is woodland,11.76 acres is barley,5.0 is potatoes,33.14 acres are hay.At present there are 56 dairy cattle,42 beef cattle.Approximately 30-35 calves are reared each year.The only product grown for retail is potatoes.The other products are grown solely for the farm's use.The farmer does a milk round.
